trans-unit.source: Implements a client channel for remote calls that uses the HTTP protocol to transmit messages.
Channels transport messages across remoting boundaries (for example, between computers or application domains).
The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel> class transports messages using the HTTP protocol.
Channels are used by the .NET Framework remoting infrastructure to transport remote calls.
When a client makes a call to a remote object, the call is serialized into a message that is sent by a client channel and received by a server channel.
It is then deserialized and processed.
Any returned values are transmitted by the server channel and received by the client channel.

A <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel> object has associated configuration properties that can be set at run time either in a configuration file (by invoking the static <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingConfiguration.Configure%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method) or programmatically (by passing a <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> collection to the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel.%23ctor%2A> constructor).
For a list of these configuration properties, see [Channel and Formatter Configuration Properties](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/226ecf74-ebbd-4ea0-a701-dcf4441deefe).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel"></xref> class.
The configuration properties of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel> instance returned by this constructor are all set to their default values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel"></xref> class with a server channel that listens on the specified port.
When this constructor is used the default <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IClientChannelSinkProvider> used is the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.SoapClientFormatterSinkProvider>.
The port on which the server channel listens.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel"></xref> class with the specified configuration properties and sinks.
For more information about channel configuration properties, see [Channel and Formatter Configuration Properties](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/226ecf74-ebbd-4ea0-a701-dcf4441deefe).

Channel sinks provide a plug-in point that allows access to the underlying messages flowing through the channel as well as the stream used by the transport mechanism to send messages to a remote object.
Channel sinks are also responsible for transporting messages between the client and the server.
Channel sinks are linked together in a chain, and all channel messages flow through this chain of sinks before the message is finally serialized and transported.
If you do not require sink functionality, set the `clientSinkProvider` and `serverSinkProvider` parameters to `null`.
A <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> collection that specifies values for configuration properties to be used by the client and server channels.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IClientChannelSinkProvider"></xref> implementation to be used by the client channel.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IServerChannelSinkProvider"></xref> implementation to be used by the server channel.
A configuration property was incorrectly formatted.
Adds a URI on which the channel hook should listen.
Code should not call the `AddHookChannelUri` method directly.
The data object can be used to pass a specific initialization state to the channel.
Should always be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel"></xref>
Gets the channel-specific data.
The current property is used when <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingServices.Marshal%2A> is called and a <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ObjRef> is created.
The channel data.
Gets the name of the current channel.
Every registered channel has a unique name.
The name is used to retrieve a specific channel when calling <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.ChannelServices.GetChannel%2A>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the name of the channel.
Gets the priority of the current channel.
The priority controls the order in which competing clients connect to a given endpoint; higher priority channels connect before lower priority channels.
The default priority is 1; negative priorities are allowed.
An integer that represents the priority assigned to the channel.
Gets the type of listener to hook into (for example, "http").
The value of the current property is not case-sensitive.
The type of listener to hook into.
Gets the channel sink chain that the current channel is using.

Channel sinks provide a plug-in point that allows access to the underlying messages flowing through the channel as well as the stream used by the transport mechanism to send messages to a remote object.
Channel sinks are linked together in a chain of channel sink providers and all channel messages flow through this chain of sinks before the message is finally serialized and transported.
The channel sink chain that the current channel is using.
Returns a channel message sink that delivers messages to the specified URL or channel data object.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel.CreateMessageSink%2A> method returns a channel message sink that delivers messages to either the specified URL or the channel data object.
If the `uri` parameter is `null`, `remoteChannelData` is used as a target for the sink.
Either the `url` or `remoteChannelData` parameters can be `null`, but not both.
The URL to which the new sink will deliver messages.
Can be `null`.
The channel data object of the remote host to which the new sink will deliver messages.
Can be `null`.
When this method returns, contains a URI of the new channel message sink that delivers messages to the specified URL or channel data object.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
A channel message sink that delivers messages to the specified URL or channel data object.
Returns an array of all the URLs for an object with the specified URI, hosted on the current <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel"></xref>.
This method is used by <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.ChannelServices.GetUrlsForObject%2A>.
The URI of the object for which URL's are required.
An array of the URLs for an object with the specified URI, hosted on the current <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel"></xref>.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the current channel is secure.

This property need not be set explicitly, as it is sufficient to set the ensureSecurity parameter of <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.RemotingConfiguration.Configure%28System.String%2CSystem.Boolean%29>.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the current instance is secure.
Returns the specified channel property.
The key of the channel property to retrieve.
A that represents the channel property specified by key.
Gets a <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of keys that the channel properties are associated with.
Channel properties are used to configure the channel at run time.
For a list of possible channel properties and an example, see [Channel and Formatter Configuration Properties](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/226ecf74-ebbd-4ea0-a701-dcf4441deefe).
A <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of keys that the channel properties are associated with.
Extracts the channel URI and the remote well-known object URI from the specified URL.
The URL from which to extract the URI of the remote well-known object.
When this method returns, contains a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that holds the URI of the remote well-known object.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
The URI of the current channel, or `null` if the specified URL is not an HTTP URL.
Gets a <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> of the channel properties associated with the current channel.
Channels properties are used to configure the channel at run time.

The `Properties` property returns channel properties of the underlying <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpServerChannel> and <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpClientChannel>.
For a list of possible channel properties and an example, see [Channel and Formatter Configuration Properties](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/226ecf74-ebbd-4ea0-a701-dcf4441deefe).
A <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> of the channel properties associated with the current channel.
Instructs the current channel to start listening for requests.
The data object can be used to pass a specific initialization state to the channel.
Should always be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.Http.HttpChannel"></xref>.
Instructs the current channel to stop listening for requests.
The channel URI on which the channel hook is listening.
Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether the current instance wants to be hooked into the outside listener service.
A Boolean value that indicates whether <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IChannelReceiverHook"></xref> wants to be hooked into the outside listener service.
